elements.name: DescribeInstitutionalArrangements
elements.title: Please describe the institutional arrangements and governance at the national level for the planning, implementing, monitoring, evaluating and revising adaptation policy. (max. 3000 characters)This while considering the following aspects: decision making, planning and coordination related to adaptation strategies, policies, plans and goals, addressing cross-cutting issues, adjusting adaptation priorities and activities, implementing adaptation actions, including facilitating action to avert, minimise and address the adverse effect of climate change

elements.name: DescribeClimateChangeResilience
elements.title: Please describe how climate change impacts and resilience are integrated into environmental assessment procedures (max. 750 characters)

elements.name: DescribeCollection
elements.title: Please describe the collection, ownership and re-use of relevant data (such as climate-related disaster loss data or risk data) and access to it (max. 750 characters)

elements.name: DescribeClimateChangeImpacts
elements.title: Please describe how climate change impacts and adaptation planning into disaster risk management frameworks are integrated, and vice versa. How are climate change impacts and adaptation planning integrated into disaster risk management frameworks and vice versa (max 750 characters). This by including relevant aspects of Article 6(1) of Decision No 1313/2013/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2013 on a Union Civil Protection Mechanism (OJ L 347 I, 20.12.2013, p. 924)
Institutional arrangements and governance at the sub-national level (where  “sub-national” refers to local and regional)

elements.name: SummarizeLegalRequirements
elements.title: Please summarize the legal requirements and strategic documents for institutional arrangements and governance at the sub-national level (max. 750 characters)

elements.name: SummarizeNetworks
elements.title: Please summarize the networks or other collaborations on adaptation across national, local and regional authorities

elements.name: Challenges
elements.title: Please describe challenges, gaps and barriers to adaptation, including those institutional, governance-related and other barriers that restrict the adaptive capacity as identified in the vulnerability assessment (see Chapter 2 of this reporting) (max. 2000 characters)

elements.name: SummaryNationalStrategies
elements.title: Please provide a summary of national strategies, policies, plans and efforts, with a focus on goals and objectives (max. 5000 characters)

elements.name: SummaryForeseenActions
elements.title: Please provide a summary of foreseen actions, budget and timeline. This should include nature-based solutions and actions leading to mitigation co-benefits and other relevant co-benefits. The summaries shall also cover efforts to build resilience and avert, minimise and address the adverse consequences of climate change, and include an explanation how gender perspectives have been taken into account. (max. 10 000 characters)Consider also the following optional reporting to provide details on actions and (programmes of) measures

tables.name: Cooperation_Experience
tables.label: Cooperation and experience
tables.title: Cooperation, good practices, synergies, experience and lessons learned in the field of adaptation

elements.name: DescribeGeneralAspects
elements.title: Please describe general aspects of good practices and lessons learnt, including at sub-national level1 (max. 1000 characters, details need to be provided in the following text fields)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesClimate
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to climate modelling activities and methodologies - assessment of climate impacts, vulnerability and risks to climate change (including adaptive capacity) (max. 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesInstitutional
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to institutional arrangements and governance at the national and sub-national level - policy and regulatory changes -  coordination mechanisms (max. 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesAdaptation
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to adaptation priorities - adaptation barriers - adaptation goals, objectives, undertakings, efforts, strategies, policies and plans (max. 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesEfforts
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to efforts to integrate climate change adaptation into development and sectoral policies, plans and programs - disaster risk reduction and management (max. 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesStakeholder
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to stakeholder engagement - integration of gender perspectives into climate adaptation - integration of indigenous, traditional and local knowledge into climate adaptation (max. 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesClimateRisk
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to climate risk communication (max 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesMonitoring
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to monitoring, reporting and evaluation (max 1000 characters)

elements.name: DescribeGoodPracticesStrengthening
elements.title: Please describe good practices and lessons learned related to strengthening scientific research and knowledge - innovative adaptation solutions and innovative financing mechanisms (max. 2000 characters)
